content: Nice problem, and well explained! Might be useful to specify the maximum length of the message and the key.

I like how the goal was to-the-point and specific and also how you explained an example.

Maybe specify in the constraints that the whole string is in lowercase?
Thank you very much for your comment Dear TrebuchetMS. I am specifying that. Thanks a lot...

Hello albantor30, Thanks for your comment. I am going to add a constraint to specify that there s no size limit to neither the message nor the key size. The only thing to remember is that if the key is short than the message, the key will be repeated to match the size of the message and if the key is longer than the message, only the key part which will be as long as the message will be considered. so there s no limit to the strength of the decoder... Thanks once again for your comment...

Hi Arcene. The relationship between the message and key lengths is indeed already explained in the statement. I was rather thinking about programming languages where the size of a memory allocation has to be explicit (like in C, where you have to specify the max length of a string when declaring it). Since your stub generator specifies text<256 and code<50, it might be worth mention it. Thanks again for the cool problem!
